gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Indiana Districts and Representatives for the 113th Congress: Indiana, 2013

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: United States Department of Commerce, United States Census Bureau (Data creator)

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: This data set shows the newly redistricted boundaries (adopted in May 2011) of Indiana's nine districts for the 113th U.S. Congress and provides the name, party affiliation, and additional contact information for each of the representatives. NOTE: Redistricting of all Indiana legislative boundaries were adopted in May 2011, and will be used from 2011 through 2021. Republicans who controlled the Indiana House and Senate from the 117th General Assembly oversaw the drawing of new maps in the Spring of 2011 for all 100 state house and 50 state senate districts and Indiana's nine congressional seats. New political districts are drawn every 10 years to incorporate information from the latest U.S. Census.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: CONGRESS_DISTRICTS_113TH_USCB_IN.SHP was created to provide a GIS data layer of the Indiana districts of the 113th congress.

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: This file is available to anyone, but access may be contingent on written request, specific terms relevant to the agency or person making the request, and/or current freedom of information statutes in the state of Indiana.

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: Windows 7 Enterprise operating system; ESRI ArcGIS 10.0 shapefile; 120 Kb

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: No checks for logical consistency were made.
This data set provides the 113th U.S. Congressional District boundaries for Indiana, and is assumed to be complete.
The attributes were derived from the official Web sites of each Representative, and are assumed to be correct.
No information was provided by the U.S. Census Bureau pertaining to the horizontal positional accuracy of the source data.
The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the production of this data.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: A copy of the shapefile named "CONGRESS_DISTRICTS_111TH_USCB_IN.SHP" was opened in ESRI ArcMap. The attributes of the shapefile for CONGRESS_DISTRICTS_111TH_USCB_IN was then edited in ESRI ArcMap to reflect changes between the 111th and 112th Congresses. The updated shapefile was then renamed to "CONGRESS_DISTRICTS_112TH_USCB_IN.SHP". The information listed for Todd Rokita (newly elected to the 112th Congress) was obtained from the following URL: http://rokita.house.gov/ The information listed for Todd Young (newly elected to the 112th Congress) was obtained from the following URL: http://toddyoung.house.gov/ The information listed for Larry Bucshon (newly elected to the 112th Congress) was obtained from the following URL: http://bucshon.house.gov/ The information listed for Marlin Stutzman (newly elected to the 112th Congress) was obtained from the following URL: http://stutzman.house.gov/

CD18_108_SHP.ZIP was downloaded from the USCB and unzipped. ESRI ArcToolBox "Define Projection Wizard" was then used on CD18_108.SHP to define the projection provided, which was Geographic (Lat/Long) NAD83. ESRI ArcToolBox "Project Wizard" was then used to reproject to UTM Zone 16, NAD83, and the output shapefile was named CONGRESS_DISTRICTS_108TH_USCB_IN.SHP. ESRI ArcMap was then used to edit the shapefile, and the following fields were dropped from the attribute table: "Area," "Perimeter," "CD18_108_," "CD18_108_I," "State," "LSAD," "LSAD_TRANS," and "NAME." The following fields were then added to CONGRESS_DISTRICTS_108TH_USCB_IN.SHP: "Representa," "Party," "Web_Site," "E_Mail," "1_Address," "1_CityZip," "1_Phone," "1_Fax," "2_Address," "2_CityZip," "2_Phone," "2_Fax," "3_Address," "3_CityZip," "3_Phone," "3_Fax," "4_Address," "4_CityZip," "4_Phone," and "4_Fax." These fields were populated with data found at the following URL: http://www.iauw.org/capitolsteps/IndianaCongressionalDelegation.htm

The shapefile named "CONGRESS_DISTRICTS_108TH_USCB_IN.SHP" was opened in ESRI ArcView, and the "Convert to Shapefile" tool was used to create a copy named "CONGRESS_DISTRICTS_109TH_USCB_IN.SHP." The attributes of the shapefile for CONGRESS_DISTRICTS_109TH_USCB_IN was then edited in ESRI ArcView to reflect changes between the 108th and 109th Congresses. The information listed for Mike Sodrel (newly elected to the 109th Congress) was obtained from the following URL: http://www.house.gov/sodrel/

The shapefile named "CONGRESS_DISTRICTS_109TH_USCB_IN.SHP" was opened in ESRI ArcView, and the "Convert to Shapefile" tool was used to create a copy named "CONGRESS_DISTRICTS_110TH_USCB_IN.SHP." The attributes of the shapefile for CONGRESS_DISTRICTS_110TH_USCB_IN was then edited in ESRI ArcView to reflect changes between the 109th and 110th Congresses. The information listed for Joe Donnelly, Brad Ellsworth and Baron Hill (newly elected to the 110th Congress) was obtained from the following URL: http://www.house.gov/

A copy of the shapefile named "CONGRESS_DISTRICTS_110TH_USCB_IN.SHP" was opened in ESRI ArcMap. The attributes of the shapefile for CONGRESS_DISTRICTS_110TH_USCB_IN was then edited in ESRI ArcMap to reflect changes between the 110th and 111th Congresses. The updated shapefile was then renamed to "CONGRESS_DISTRICTS_111TH_USCB_IN.SHP". The information listed for Andre Carson (newly elected to the 111th Congress) was obtained from the following URL: http://carson.house.gov/

REDISTRICTED_INDIANA_CONGRESSIONAL_DISTRICTS_2011_IED.SHP was opened in ESRI ArcGIS 10.1 and each legislative district boundary was attributed with the name and party affiliation of the legislator for the 113th U.S. Congress. This information was obtained from the offical web site for each elected Representative, which were obtained from ( http://www.govtrack.us/congress/members/IN ). The shapfile was then renamed to CONGRESS_DISTRICTS_113th_USCB_IN.SHP.

This metadata file was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v. 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v. 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (U.S. Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."
All redistricted district boundaries for U.S. Congressional Districts in Indiana, adopted in 2011 (good until 2021)

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It is not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone other than the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Metadata was created as or translated to ISO 19139 for inclusion in the Big Ten Academic Alliance Geoportal.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: Big Ten Academic Alliance Geospatial Data Project
